entry.title: In the Shadow of the Holocaust, a Jewish Community Begins to Take Root
entry.content: Poland’s Jewish community—nearly destroyed during World War II—is growing again, but connecting people with their heritage is a race against time.

entry.title: Migrant Dies as Belarus-Poland Border Standoff Deepens
entry.content: The body of a young Syrian man was found Friday, Polish border authorities said, the latest casualty in a monthslong standoff between the EU and Belarus’s authoritarian leader.

entry.title: As the U.S. Races to Vaccinate Kids, Some Countries Hold Back
entry.content: Immunizing children against Covid-19 is viewed by authorities in the U.S. and elsewhere as critical to get the upper hand over the virus. But in some parts of the world, such efforts have generated deep controversy.
